item.title: More household rubbish left, 21st November
item.description:
Friday 21st November, rubbish bag left with the cardboard boxes. Perhaps the same person. Could you please contact her and let her know the correct place to put her rubbish for collection.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rufus Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Household rubbish left on pavement, 21st November
item.description:
Two cardboard boxes left on the pavement. Per the address labels, Katya Sharma, Flat F, 309-311 Old Street, is responsible. Please could you let her know the correct place to drop household rubbish is on the pavement of Hoxton Square

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rufus Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The rubbish guys turned over one of the bins and left it, 21st November
item.description:
Hi there… I’m not sure what happened but when the rubbish was picked up at 8:30a this morning, one of the guys flipped the bin and left it the bike parking spots (upside down). It is blocking the sidewalk and the bike parking, can this be corrected, please? Thanks!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southwark Bridge Road, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving stones dangerously broken outside our front gate, 21st November
item.description:
Building works at next door house no 56 over the last twelve months have caused the pavement outside our house to be cracked to such an extent that we feel unsafe walking outside our gate. (What3words location:invest.added.runs). We are particularly worried that the depth of the cracks mean that in wet weather in the winter there will be deep ice which will be dangerous for us and for the public.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alfriston Road, Clapham Junction, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole/manhole cover open/damaged, 21st November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Worsley Bridge Road, Beckenham, Greater London

item.title: Unswept area and littering, 21st November
item.description:
The whole stretch of northwold road (north side) from number 71 to the church has not been swept in weeks. Litter has built up at the bus stop.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Northwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Significant damage to paths either side of norman road, 21st November
item.description:
This road is currently unwalkable due to the severe damage and unstable concrete along the footpaths. There are broken and uneven sections of concrete across the entire stretch, leaving no safe place to walk, particularly when the ground is wet and becomes extremely slippery. It poses a clear safety risk to pedestrians and needs urgent repair.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Norman Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
